alert.note: Alert for La Paz; Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 31 at 4:22PM MST until July 31 at 5:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Northern La Paz County in west central Arizona... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Riverside County in southern California... * Until 530 PM MST/530 PM PDT/. * At 422 PM MST/422 PM PDT/, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 9 miles north of Aguila to 10 miles northwest of Wenden to 6 miles southwest of Brenda, moving northwest at 35 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 22 and 42. US Highway 60 between mile markers 31 and 74. AZ Route 72 between mile markers 14 and 49. Locations impacted include... Parker, Alamo Lake, Quartzsite, Alamo Lake State Park, Salome, Brenda, Buckskin Mountain Park, Bouse, Vicksburg Junction, Wenden, Vicksburg, Harcuvar and Poston. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
